params.amounts: the amounts of each token to add, in their native precision
params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction
params.minToMint: the minimum LP tokens adding this amount of liquidity should mint, otherwise revert. Handy for front-running mitigation

returns._0: amount of LP token user minted and received

params.amount: the amount of LP tokens that would be burned on withdrawal

returns._0: array of token balances that the user will receive

params.tokenAmount: the amount of LP token to burn
params.tokenIndex: index of which token will be withdrawn

returns._0: availableTokenAmount calculated amount of underlying token available to withdraw

params.dx: the amount of tokens the user wants to sell. If the token charges a fee on transfers, use the amount that gets transferred after the fee.
params.tokenIndexFrom: the token the user wants to sell
params.tokenIndexTo: the token the user wants to buy

returns._0: amount of tokens the user will receive

calculateTokenAmount(uint256[],bool).details: This shouldn't be used outside frontends for user estimates.

params.amounts: an array of token amounts to deposit or withdrawal, corresponding to pooledTokens. The amount should be in each pooled token's native precision. If a token charges a fee on transfers, use the amount that gets transferred after the fee.
params.deposit: whether this is a deposit or a withdrawal

returns._0: token amount the user will receive
address of the token at given index

params._baseSwap: the address of the base Swap contract
params._metaLPToken: the address of the MetaSwap LP token contract
params._metaSwap: the address of the MetaSwap contract

removeLiquidity(uint256,uint256[],uint25.details: Liquidity can always be removed, even when the pool is paused.

params.amount: the amount of LP tokens to burn
params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction
params.minAmounts: the minimum amounts of each token in the pool        acceptable for this burn. Useful as a front-running mitigation

params.amounts: how much of each token to withdraw
params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction
params.maxBurnAmount: the max LP token provider is willing to pay to remove liquidity. Useful as a front-running mitigation.

params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction
params.minAmount: the minimum amount to withdraw, otherwise revert
params.tokenAmount: the amount of the token you want to receive
params.tokenIndex: the index of the token you want to receive

returns._0: amount of chosen token user received

params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction
params.dx: the amount of tokens the user wants to swap from
params.minDy: the min amount the user would like to receive, or revert.
params.tokenIndexFrom: the token the user wants to swap from
params.tokenIndexTo: the token the user wants to swap to

addLiquidity(uint256[],uint256,uint256).notice: Add liquidity to the pool with the given amounts of tokens

calculateRemoveLiquidity(uint256).notice: A simple method to calculate amount of each underlying tokens that is returned upon burning given amount of LP tokens

calculateRemoveLiquidityOneToken(uint256.notice: Calculate the amount of underlying token available to withdraw when withdrawing via only single token

calculateSwap(uint8,uint8,uint256).notice: Calculate amount of tokens you receive on swap

calculateTokenAmount(uint256[],bool).notice: A simple method to calculate prices from deposits or withdrawals, excluding fees but including slippage. This is helpful as an input into the various "min" parameters on calls to fight front-running. When withdrawing from the base pool in imbalanced fashion, the recommended slippage setting is 0.2% or higher.

getToken(uint8).notice: Returns the address of the pooled token at given index. Reverts if tokenIndex is out of range. This is a flattened representation of the pooled tokens.

initialize(address,address,address).notice: Sets the address for the base Swap contract, MetaSwap contract, and the MetaSwap LP token contract.

removeLiquidity(uint256,uint256[],uint25.notice: Burn LP tokens to remove liquidity from the pool. Withdraw fee that decays linearly over period of 4 weeks since last deposit will apply.

removeLiquidityImbalance(uint256[],uint2.notice: Remove liquidity from the pool, weighted differently than the pool's current balances. Withdraw fee that decays linearly over period of 4 weeks since last deposit will apply.

removeLiquidityOneToken(uint256,uint8,ui.notice: Remove liquidity from the pool all in one token. Withdraw fee that decays linearly over period of 4 weeks since last deposit will apply.

swap(uint8,uint8,uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: Swap two underlying tokens using the meta pool and the base pool

userdoc.notice: This contract flattens the LP token in a MetaSwap pool for easier user access. MetaSwap must be deployed before this contract can be initialized successfully. For example, suppose there exists a base Swap pool consisting of [DAI, USDC, USDT]. Then a MetaSwap pool can be created with [sUSD, BaseSwapLPToken] to allow trades between either the LP token or the underlying tokens and sUSD. MetaSwapDeposit flattens the LP token and remaps them to a single array, allowing users to ignore the dependency on BaseSwapLPToken. Using the above example, MetaSwapDeposit can act as a Swap containing [sUSD, DAI, USDC, USDT] tokens.
